caption: Seeing a collection of such exceptional and historic cameras hosted among one of the most iconic Parisian photography houses was a true cultural experience.

The 99 Cameras Museum inside Studio Harcourt is an absolute gem for photography enthusiasts. The historical ambiance and the remarkable collection of cameras take you on a journey through the evolution of photography. The attention to detail and curation is outstanding. It's a must-visit for anyone with a passion for photography and its rich history. üì∑üèõÔ∏è

If you love the history of photography this is the place to go. The most complete and interesting collection of historical cameras on the planet displayed in one of Paris' oldest and most renowned photo studios, Studio Harcourt. You can still feel the energy of all celebrities who once shared this space. Highly recommended!

I recently had the pleasure of visiting the 99 Cameras Museum during my trip to Paris, and it turned out to be a true gem for photography enthusiasts and anyone interested in the history of analog cameras. The museum boasts a unique and extensive collection of cameras, each with its own fascinating story and historical significance.  Federico, who gave me a personal tour, was incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about the collection, making the experience even more engaging and insightful.  If you find yourself in Paris, this museum is a must-visit. ü§© It‚Äôs an experience that will leave you with a newfound appreciation for the art of analog photography.

Small camera & photo museum with the free admission. An interesting collections of old cameras. They have the spy camera Minox produced in Riga, LATVIA. Annoying fact that they have labeled the country of origin as Lithuania. Riga is in LATVIA, not Lithuania. About the inventor, Minox Camera was invented from 1937‚Äì1942, by Designer Valters Caps (1905‚Äì2003) https://kulturaskanons.lv/en/archive/fotoaparats-minox/ The spelling of the name in the museum is taken from German but Valters is Latvian. Also, there is lovely and secluded caf√© on the 1st floor with great ambiance but no desire from caf√© to sell a drinks. Funny but somewhat nice...
Super interesting history of cameras but also very modern exhibition in beautiful site with wonderfull photos.

Lovely collection of antique cameras. All cameras are in excellent condition and a lot of them are rarities. The cameras are grouped by themes (beauty icons, influential, miniatures, spy cameras) and given well written blurbs in French and English explaining what makes each of them special. This elevates the experience you might have just looking at one of these beautiful pieces in isolation.

An amazing tour of the 20th century seen through its most iconic cameras. Even if you are not a cameras afficionado some of them are really fun, some are engineering masterpieces but all are interesting. Definitely worth the detour, and it's free.
Beautiful camera collection elegantly displayed. It was a pleasure to read and learn about each piece. If you are a camera lover or just love vintage pieces, this expo is a must!
Absolutely stunning collection of iconic cameras. A must for anyone who even remotely appreciates photography
Very interesting initiative in a wonderful setting. Some beautiful and unique pieces in a great display. Recommend it !
Beautiful camera collection expo at the Harcourt Studios ! A must see!

A fascinating visit! This free camera museum is a real dive into the history of photography. The collection is impressive, well organized, and each device tells a unique story. The staff is warm and passionate, ready to share anecdotes and interesting details about the pieces on display. Whether you're an amateur or an expert, you'll leave with new knowledge and a deep admiration for cameras. Not to be missed!‚Äù

Free visit to the legendary Harcourt studios, ideally located in a private mansion in the 16th arrondissement. Large collection of cameras, presenting a wide panorama. Special mention to mini spy devices. Numerous portraits of artists decorate the different rooms. I highly recommend this tour!
There are 99 iconic devices, each more wonderful than the last, absolutely worth discovering!

In a legendary place, a tiny part of the incredible collection of Mr Benincasa senior who collected and restored more than 2000 models over 50 years. Of the 2000 cameras that make up this collection, around a hundred are revealed to the public by Mr Benincasa fils. Through this collection we travel through the history of photography with emblematic, curious, unusual and incredible models.  Whether you are an amateur, a pro or simply curious, you will not be indifferent. Moreover, it is an evolving exhibition because as certain models are restored, they are exhibited.  A fun and informative exhibition at a time when the camera is part of our life and fits in the pocket that we draw for a yes or a no, not so far from a time when we saved the pedicle in admiration in front of these pieces of goldwork with a mechanical heart but far from the battle of pixels and digital technology.  Far from being negligible in Paris...It's FREE!!!

The experience was not only very rewarding, but also incredibly inspiring. Federico, founder and curator of the museum, shared his passion and in-depth knowledge with infectious enthusiasm, which made this visit very enjoyable. I highly recommend this museum to all photography enthusiasts and those who also want to expand their own cultural horizons.

An exceptional site, very complementary to the Harcourt studio, and retracing with great joy the magic of the bubbling innovation which characterized the world of film photography: congratulations on the creation of this beautiful museum!!

Magnificent mansion, very warm welcome. We were surprised by the richness of this exhibition which combines technology and aesthetics. The organizer, who was present, took us on a journey back in time. The numerous black and white photos of movie stars are sublime. A favorite for Mich√®le Morgan and No√©mie Merlant.

A collection of cameras as incredible as they are iconic in a setting worthy of this collection, within the private mansion of the legendary Maison Harcourt... Everything is well explained, accessible, with many anecdotes about these objects which have marked history... Not to be missed!

A very small part of Gianpaolo Benincasa's collection, simply impressive and a very beautiful tribute from a son to his father's passion to make this collection available in this very beautiful place (it is on the 2nd floor)  My top 3 without hesitation: - Compass from the Swiss watchmaker Jaeger-LeCoultre, from 1937 - MinoxRiga, a spy camera from Latvia, from 1937 - Hasselblad 500 C a reflex from Sweden, from 1963

I had a great time in this free museum in this legendary place of photography! An incredible collection of devices, from the great classics to the most sought-after. All this well presented in a single room, organized in a fun way (I was able to enjoy the audio guide by just scanning a QR Code).  It‚Äôs nice to see this family collection continue, expand and be shared  A little favorite on this Compass.. WOW ü§ó
An exciting panorama of film photography with very different devices. A lot of research behind it and a lot of historical and technical knowledge. Recommended.
Finally!!!! A great museum, with a lot of things about film! Thank you 99 museum cameras!
Beautiful exhibition of modern film photos, and a very interesting collection of 20th century cameras, some of which are real gems.
An inspiring initiative, which brings astonishing objects back to life, and takes us on a journey through the entire history of photography!
Excellent museum dedicated to the history of cameras! I highly recommend it if you are passionate about photography.

Superb place and museum with incredible cameras, some even unsuspected. A collection built over decades. A tribute from a son to his Father.  99 cameras museum, A museum not to be missed whether for lovers of photography, lovers of beautiful objects or the curious.
A very beautiful exhibition dedicated to a unique collection of film cameras across eras and styles, found by fervent collectors around the world. A must-have for photography enthusiasts.
We were at the inauguration of the museum!! Superb collection in a magical place. An exciting visit!! Little extra, one of the rare free museums in Paris!
Superb collection which allows you to delve into the big story through the small story of each model. The place is magnificent. A new must-see in Paris!
Great exhibition tribute to a passionate collector. For beginners or enthusiasts in a legendary setting. Little crush on ‚Äúspy‚Äù devices!
A free museum that will delight young and old alike. From iconic cameras, from miniatures to those used by secret agents and their photographic gadgets of all kinds.
The location and cameras are incredible! I recommend ++
Iconic, original, rare, very beautiful collection of cameras, well presented by the famous Studio Harcourt. A must see!
Very interesting exhibition of old cameras passed on by a collector and brought together in the superb location of the Harcourt studios. A beautiful tribute from a son to his father!
Superb visit, surprising and exciting!
Very beautiful place with an exciting and unique collection of cameras! There are rare models and entry is free!
